titleStmt.title: Several particulars of the highest concern to the kingdom of Scotland, offered to consideration, in order to the enriching the same; without interfering with, or meanly depending on forraign nations, more than is usual in all other countrys. By a friend to the proposal made by D. H. Chamberlen anno 1693, for establishing a land credit in Scotland

Several particulars of the highest concern to the kingdom of Scotland, offered to consideration, in order to the enriching the same; without interfering with, or meanly depending on forraign nations, more than is usual in all other countrys. By a friend to the proposal made by D. H. Chamberlen anno 1693, for establishing a land credit in Scotland
titleStmt.author: Chamberlen, Hugh.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by the heirs and successors of Andrew Anderson, printer to the King's most Excellent Majesty,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.

person.persName: the heirs and successors of Andrew Anderson
